availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert Wickliffe Cooper (20th KY Inf & 4th KY Cav)

body.p: Lexington, Kentucky, soldier. Lexington native. Son of Spencer Cooper and Mary H. Cooper. Married Sarah Steele Venable Cooper. Father of Wickliffe Cooper. Graduated from Dickinson College in Carlisle, Pennsylvania, in 1851. Resident of Lexington, Fayette County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 20th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a lieutenant from January 24, 1862 to April 13, 1863. Served in the 4th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a colonel from May 29, 1863 to August 21, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District No. 2, p. 18.
Roger D. Hunt, Colonels in Blue -- Indiana, Kentucky, and Tennessee: A Civil War Biographical Dictionary (Jefferson, N.C.: McFarland, 2014), 151.
"Robert Wickliffe Cooper (1831-1867)," Find A Grave, Memorial 7482977, accessed January 31, 2018, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/7482977.
